item.title: Twitter | MoPub Server-to-Server API Technical Specifications 1.0
item.description: Overview The MoPub Server-to-Server API makes it easier for ad networks and demand partners to connect with the MoPub platform outside of SDK libraries. To integrate with MoPub through the Server-to-Server API, follow the integration approval process and technical specifications...

item.title: Embedded Tweet CMS best practices
item.description: Overview An Embedded Tweets adds pieces of the global conversation happening on Twitter to your site, content, and commentary. Sites powered by a CMS or custom software can provide deeper integration with Twitter content through site-level display preferences, content macros for cross-...

item.title: Twitter for Websites
item.description: Twitter for Websites is a suite of embeddable widgets and client-side scripting tools to integrate Twitter and display Tweets in your site or web app. You can find documentation for publishers and developers here, refer to the Twitter for Websites FAQ, or ask questions or share what you...

item.title: Website implementation checklist
item.description: Overview Websites can improve content distribution, build an audience, and help viewers navigate to their best content views by including Twitter-specific markup and buttons in their pages. Connect your content with the Twitter audience. Set context with link previews Attribute content to...

item.title: AdMob Revenue Reporting
item.description: In order to set up AdMob for ad network revenue reporting: You will need to enter your AdMob Username, the AdMob API password and the AdMob API key. 1. Username This is the username that you use to log in to AdMob 2. API Password AdMob requires an API password to...

item.title: How do I obtain an API key?
item.description: You can create an application record (which includes an API key) by navigating to https://apps.twitter.com/ Most integrations with the API will require you to identify your application to Twitter by way of an API key. On the Twitter platform, the term "API key" usually refers to what's called an...

item.title: Summary Card
item.description: The Summary Card can be used for many kinds of web content, from blog posts and news articles, to products and restaurants. item.description: Native Direct Ad Serving The MoPub platform allows you to integrate ads from many different advertising sources, including MoPub Marketplace and direct ads. Below is a short guide for setting up your first direct sold native ad. Set Up Your Direct Campaign...

item.title: How to Use the MoPub Dashboard
item.description: How to Use the MoPub Dashboard The MoPub Dashboard enables you to see your entire monetization strategy on a single screen. The Dashboard offers a single, comprehensive view of all your app revenue data -- including ad networks, MoPub Marketplace, and direct campaigns. With the Dashboard...

item.title: Setting Up Custom URIs
item.description: To have the click through of ads go to an in-app purchase, you'll need to set up a custom URI scheme like so: http://mobiledevelopertips.com/cocoa/launching-your-own-application-via-a-custom-url-scheme.html. Once you do that, all you have to do is drop the custom URI into the click through...

item.title: MoPub OpenRTB 2.1 Specification
item.description: Updated August 4,2014 1. Overview MoPub RTB is a way for DSPs and advertisers to bid on each ad impression where the winning bid will pay the second-highest price in the auction. This protocol is largely based on the OpenRTB 2.1 specification. Note that our adaptation may require certain...

item.title: Marketplace Payments
item.description: The revenues and other data displayed in the Marketplace dashboard may be different than the final payment.  There are several reasons for this.  The values shown in the dashboard are based on real-time data feed.  At the end of the processing period, MoPub will look at the actual...

item.title: Marketplace Video
item.description: Video ads offer a valuable opportunity to drive more revenue for your interstitial inventory.  MoPub enables you to automatically introduce video ads from MoPub Marketplace demand partners without burdening your app with additional SDKs.
